New Records: Chris Jordan took a hat-trick and four wickets in five balls.
Jos Buttler made an unbeaten 83 off 38 balls as England chased 116 in just 9.4 overs.
Adil Rashid moved level with Stuart Broad as England’s leading wicket taker in men’s T20 World Cups with 30.
Key Match Events: England won by 10 wickets, chasing 116 in just 9.4 overs.
Chris Jordan took a hat-trick and four wickets in five balls.
Jos Buttler hit five sixes in an over en route to 83* off 38 balls.
Adil Rashid and Sam Curran each took two wickets.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Jordan expressed pride in the team's performance and emphasized the importance of producing their best even when not under pressure.
Jos Buttler highlighted the importance of maintaining his form into the semi-finals and praised Chris Jordan's performance.
Adil Rashid reflected on the team's exceptional bowling performance and praised Chris Jordan and Jos Buttler for their contributions.
USA skipper Aaron Jones acknowledged the team's lack of discipline and the impact of Adil Rashid's bowling.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's victory secured their place in the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup.
England's opponents in the semi-finals will be confirmed over the next 48 hours.
USA's performance in the World Cup has increased support and interest in cricket in the United States.
